documents.document:
Do You Need Ultrasonic Cleaners?

If you are trying to determine whether or not you need ultrasonic cleaners, you should ask yourself the following questions.

· Do your parts need to be extremely clean either during the manufacturing process or once they are completed?
· Are your parts complexly shaped with a compacted geometry?
· Would you prefer an environmentally friendly parts cleaning option?
· Do you need to clean your parts as quickly as possible?

If you answered yes to any or all of these questions, then ultrasonic cleaners might be a good choice for your business and your parts.

How Ultrasonic Cleaning Works

When you use ultrasonic cleaners, you will load the parts into the parts washer, where they will be immersed in the solution. The solution is then vibrated through the use of ultrasonic waves. Some ultrasonic cleaners use rods that are inserted into the solution and some cleaners use generators and transducers to create the ultrasonic waves.

The ultrasonic sound waves create something called cavitation bubbles, which collapse or implode with great force. This action allows the solution to clean even very small contaminants off of your parts. This type of cleaning is very effective when it comes to cleaning very small, intricate parts as well.

This process leaves parts very clean. This is often a good cleaning process for businesses that manufacture medical instruments or for hospitals. Ultrasonic cleaners can be used to clean the parts, and then autoclaves can be used to sterilise them.

Ultrasonic cleaners are often better for the environment because in many instances they do not have to use harsh solvents, or they do not have to use much of the solvent solution. They are also very fast, and ultrasonic cleaning often only takes a few minutes.

Try Out Ultrasonic Cleaners at Kumi Solutions

Kumi Solutions is a UK company that sells a wide variety of parts washers including ultrasonic cleaners. The staff at Kumi has aqueous cleaners, solvent based cleaners, solvent degreasers, and more available for sale at the company’s facility in Nuneaton. Because they sell such a wide variety of cleaners, they can offer you unbiased help when it comes to selecting the perfect parts washer for your business. They will work with you to help you find the best solution for your parts and your business.

If you are interested in the ultrasonic cleaners that Kumi Solutions has to offer, all you have to do is make an appointment to visit their facility. They have four different ultrasonic cleaners, and you can try them all. You can even bring your own dirty parts and try them out in these machines. This way you can see first-hand how well these cleaners work. Once the cleaner finishes with your parts, Kumi will help you to test the cleanliness so that you can really see just how effective they are.

In addition to have four different machines, they also offer four different cleaning solutions including three solvent solutions and an aqueous cleaning solution.

If you are interested in finding the best ultrasonic cleaners available, you should contact Kumi Solutions today.

Do You Need Ultrasonic Cleaners?, Do You Need Ultrasonic Cleaners?

Do You Need Ultrasonic Cleaners?

If you are trying to determine whether or not you need ultrasonic cleaners, you should ask yourself the following questions.

· Do your parts need to be extremely clean either during the manufacturing process or once they are completed?
· Are your parts complexly shaped with a compacted geometry?
· Would you prefer an environmentally friendly parts cleaning option?
· Do you need to clean your parts as quickly as possible?

If you answered yes to any or all of these questions, then ultrasonic cleaners might be a good choice for your business and your parts.

How Ultrasonic Cleaning Works

When you use ultrasonic cleaners, you will load the parts into the parts washer, where they will be immersed in the solution. The solution is then vibrated through the use of ultrasonic waves. Some ultrasonic cleaners use rods that are inserted into the solution and some cleaners use generators and transducers to create the ultrasonic waves.

The ultrasonic sound waves create something called cavitation bubbles, which collapse or implode with great force. This action allows the solution to clean even very small contaminants off of your parts. This type of cleaning is very effective when it comes to cleaning very small, intricate parts as well.

This process leaves parts very clean. This is often a good cleaning process for businesses that manufacture medical instruments or for hospitals. Ultrasonic cleaners can be used to clean the parts, and then autoclaves can be used to sterilise them.

Ultrasonic cleaners are often better for the environment because in many instances they do not have to use harsh solvents, or they do not have to use much of the solvent solution. They are also very fast, and ultrasonic cleaning often only takes a few minutes.

Try Out Ultrasonic Cleaners at Kumi Solutions

Kumi Solutions is a UK company that sells a wide variety of parts washers including ultrasonic cleaners. The staff at Kumi has aqueous cleaners, solvent based cleaners, solvent degreasers, and more available for sale at the company’s facility in Nuneaton. Because they sell such a wide variety of cleaners, they can offer you unbiased help when it comes to selecting the perfect parts washer for your business. They will work with you to help you find the best solution for your parts and your business.

If you are interested in the ultrasonic cleaners that Kumi Solutions has to offer, all you have to do is make an appointment to visit their facility. They have four different ultrasonic cleaners, and you can try them all. You can even bring your own dirty parts and try them out in these machines. This way you can see first-hand how well these cleaners work. Once the cleaner finishes with your parts, Kumi will help you to test the cleanliness so that you can really see just how effective they are.

In addition to have four different machines, they also offer four different cleaning solutions including three solvent solutions and an aqueous cleaning solution.

If you are interested in finding the best ultrasonic cleaners available, you should contact Kumi Solutions today.
